intro: Pycreus melanostachyus, commonly known as the black-stalked pycreus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its dark purple stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Pycreus melanostachyus is often grown for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in partial shade with well-drained soil.
